```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```


```{r import}

make_data<-read_csv("Group+Projects+2021_November+18,+2021_11.53.csv", col_select = c(Q351,Q352,Q353,Q356,Q357,Q358,Q359,Q360,Q361,Q354_1,Q354_2,Q354_3,Q354_4)) #selects only our question columns
make_data<-make_data[-c(1:2),] #remove rows not number data
write_csv(make_data, "media_data.csv") #make new dataset csv

media_data<-read_csv("media_data.csv") #now open csv so that all variables register as numbers and not characters
remove(make_data) #remove extra open dataset


```

```{r newcolumn}
# adjust reverse scored questions
test<-media_data %>% mutate(Q354_2= case_when( Q354_2==5~1, Q354_2==4~2, Q354_2==2~4,Q354_2==3~3,  Q354_2==1~5), Q354_3= case_when( Q354_3==5~1, Q354_3==4~2,Q354_3==3~3, Q354_3==2~4, Q354_3==1~5))

#add new columns
media_data<-media_data %>% 
  mutate(mood= case_when( 
    !is.na(Q351) | !is.na(Q352) | !is.na(Q353) ~ 'neutral', #if 351, 352, 353 have answer post mood= neutral
    !is.na(Q356) | !is.na(Q357) | !is.na(Q358) ~ 'stress', #if 356, 357, 358 have answer post mood= stress
    !is.na(Q359) | !is.na(Q360) | !is.na(Q361) ~ 'happy' ),#if 359, 360, 361 have answer post mood= happy
    score= Q354_1+Q354_2+Q354_3+Q354_4) #the score of the stress scale 

```
